checkAfterExecution(bytes32,bool).details: The function needs to implement a check after the execution of the transaction.

params.hash: The hash of the executed transaction.
params.success: The status of the transaction execution.

checkTransaction(address,uint256,bytes,u.details: The function needs to implement transaction validation logic.

params.baseGas: The base gas for the transaction.
params.gasPrice: The price of gas in Wei for the transaction.
params.gasToken: The token used to pay for gas.
params.msgSender: The address of the message sender.
params.refundReceiver: The address which should receive the refund.
params.to: The address to which the transaction is intended.
params.value: The native token value of the transaction in Wei.

supportsInterface(bytes4).details: See the corresponding EIP section <https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified>      to learn more about how these ids are created.      This function call must use less than 30.000 gas.

params.interfaceId: The ID of the interface to check support for.

returns._0: Whether or not the interface is supported.

checkAfterExecution(bytes32,bool).notice: Checks after execution of the transaction.

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by `interfaceId`.
